daily_fact: Renowned chef Andrew Carmellini, known for his culinary excellence, shares his passion for New York City’s vibrant food scene, highlighting the community's rich diversity and innovation in gastronomy.
topline_md: A massive 5-alarm blaze in Ridgewood injured two firefighters and a resident, while a roof collapse in Manhattan left six injured; simultaneously, New York hospitals reinstated mask mandates amid a record flu outbreak, prompting a surge in hospitalizations.

risks_alerts.title: Risks & Alerts
risks_alerts.summary_md:
### Risks & Alerts

- Two firefighters and one resident injured in a massive 5-alarm blaze in Ridgewood, Queens. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Six people injured in a roof collapse accident at apartments on West 107th Street in Manhattan. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Masks are returning to New York hospitals due to a 2026 ‘super flu’ outbreak. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- New York reports a record number of flu-related hospitalizations amid the ongoing outbreak. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- FDA recalls radioactive shrimp, including some products sold in New York. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
